pageTitle: Prime Minister’s itinerary for Friday, August 26, 2022 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Note: All times local

4 Wing Cold Lake, Alberta

8:00 a.m. The Prime Minister and the Secretary General of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO), Jens Stoltenberg, will participate in a welcoming ceremony featuring an honour guard.

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage
  • Media are asked to arrive no later than 7:15 a.m.
  • Media interested in participating can contact media@pmo-cpm.gc.ca for details.

8:15 a.m. The Prime Minister will meet with the Secretary General of NATO, Jens Stoltenberg.

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity at the start of the meeting

9:30 a.m. The Prime Minister and the Secretary General of NATO, Jens Stoltenberg, will hold a joint media availability. Minister of National Defence Anita Anand, Minister of Foreign Affairs Mélanie Joly, and Minister of Northern Affairs, Minister responsible for Prairies Economic Development Canada and Minister responsible for the Canadian Northern Economic Development Agency Dan Vandal will also be in attendance.

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage
  • Media are asked to arrive no later than 8:45 a.m.
  • Media interested in participating can contact media@pmo-cpm.gc.ca for details.

11:45 a.m. The Prime Minister and the Secretary General of NATO, Jens Stoltenberg, will attend a luncheon with members of the Canadian Armed Forces. Minister of National Defence Anita Anand, Minister of Foreign Affairs Mélanie Joly, and Minister of Northern Affairs, Minister responsible for Prairies Economic Development Canada and Minister responsible for the Canadian Northern Economic Development Agency Dan Vandal will also be in attendance.

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity
